alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 11:24PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne and southeastern Johnston Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Goldsboro, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Walnut Creek, Princeton, Pikeville, Seven Springs, Mar-Mac, Brogden, Nahunta and Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
